q1.question: Are you experiencing any of the following?
contents: Severe difficulty breathing (e.g., struggling to breathe or speaking in single words)
Severe chest pain
Having a very hard time waking up
Feeling confused
Losing consciousness

q2.question: Are you experiencing any of the following?
contents: I cannot lie down because I'm having trouble breathing
I'm having trouble managing my chronic health conditions because of difficulty breathing

q3.question: Are you experiencing new or worsening symptoms?
contents: Select all the symptoms you have right now. If you dont have any of these symptoms, select 'none of the above.'

q4.question: Have you received a new COVID-19 test result?
contents: If you have not entered it here before, please enter the details of your last COVID-19 test

hwq1.question: Are you an individual who is moderately to severely immunocompromised?
contents: You’ve had an organ transplant and are taking anti-rejection medications
You are receiving treatment for cancer
You’ve had a bone marrow or stem cell transplant
You’ve been diagnosed with a moderate to severe primary immunodeficiency disorder
You have advanced or untreated HIV
You’ve been diagnosed with HIV and are not currently taking medications for it
You are on dialysis and/or have severe kidney disease
You are on active treatment with immunosuppressive therapies

hwq2.question: Are you 18 years of age and older and unvaccinated or partially vaccinated?
contents: Unvaccinated or partially vaccinated means you have not received at least 2 doses of a 2-dose series or more than 14 days after receiving a single dose of a 1-dose series.

hwq3.question: Do you work as a health care worker in a hospital, long-term care facility, assisted living facility, or community clinic, or as a first responder (i.e. police officer, emergency medical technician/paramedic, or firefighter)?

hwq4.question: Do you live or work in a congregate setting (such as a long term care facility, shelter, correctional facility, or group home) or in a community that is far from testing centres and hospitals (such as rural, remote, isolated, or Indigenous community or a work camp)?

severity.cough: What is the severity of your cough?
severity.difficultBreathing: What is the severity of your shortness of breath?
severity.soreThroat: What is the severity of your sore throat?
severity.headache: What is the severity of your headache?
severity.diarrhea: What is the severity of your diarrhea?
severity.nauseaVomiting: What is the severity of your nausea or vomiting?
severity.bodyAches: What is the severity of your body aches?

call911.title: Your symptoms require emergency medical care. Call 9-1-1 or visit an Urgent and Primary Care Centre or emergency department right away.

call811.title: You should get health advice. Contact your health care provider or call 8-1-1 to talk to a nurse at HealthLink BC.

asymptomatic.title: You do not need a COVID-19 test.
contents: If your symptoms change, retake this self-assessment to see if you need testing.

symptomaticNeedTest.title: Please get a COVID-19 test and self-isolate.
contents: If you test negative for COVID-19, stay home until you feel better.

symptomaticNoNeedTest.title: You do not need a COVID-19 test.
contents: Testing is not recommended for adults and children with mild symptoms. Stay home until you feel well enough to resume your regular activities. Avoid high risk settings (e.g. long term care facilities) and individuals at higher risk for severe complications for 10 days after the start of your symptoms.
